Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $1,841.00\*

Context:
The text provides information about the English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program offered by the college. Here are some key factual points extracted from the text:

1. Certified teachers use interactive teaching resources both in-person and online.
2. Students can choose to continue in the post-secondary stream of the EAP program, pursue English for Business Studies or English for Hospitality Studies at Levels 7 or 8.
3. Selective courses are available for students in the EAP program to develop specific communication skills, critical thinking abilities, digital skills and academic skills.
4. Upon completion of Level 8, students can pursue Level 9 studies for higher language skills required for college or university degrees, postgraduate co-op programs or field education.
5. The EAP program offers nine levels that progress from beginner to advanced levels, with two levels per 16-week semester.
6. Classes are held Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.
7. The academic year for the EAP program is 2023-2024.
8. Placement tests are offered on specific dates throughout the year, including August 22, 2023, September 5, 2023, December 21, 2023, December 19, 2023, January 8, 2024, April 26, 2024, April 23, 2024, May 6, 2024 and August 23, 2024.
9. Students who complete Level 8 or Level 9 with at least two EAP levels completed at George Brown College will earn an Ontario College Certificate. Students who complete Level 8 or Level 9 with just one EAP level completed at George Brown College will earn a George Brown College Certificate.
10. Students who complete Level 8 are exempt from the English admissions test required for most post-secondary programs at George Brown College and many other Ontario colleges. Students who complete Level 9 are deemed to have met the English admission requirements for some George Brown College degree programs and graduate certificates.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/General Arts and Science – English for Academic Purposes Program R105 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
1. Some George Brown College degree programs and graduate certificate programs with co-op or field education placements require applicants to meet the English admission requirements.
2. Mandatory admission testing, which includes English, is required for some programs. Applicants are advised to check program requirements for details.
3. Completion of Level 8 at George Brown College meets the English language requirement for most certificate and diploma programs.
4. Completion of Level 9 prepares students with the study, research, and essay-writing skills required for diploma, postgraduate, and degree-level programs.
5. Students may take a level placement test at George Brown or submit an official, valid IELTS (Academic) or TOEFL (iBT) or Duolingo test score at the time of admission or before classes begin.
6. Students are expected to complete two courses in each 16-week semester.
7. There are nine levels of English for Academic Purposes (ESL) courses offered, numbered from ESL 1111 to ESL 1119.
8. An articulation agreement exists between George Brown College and 16 other Ontario colleges, where students who successfully complete EAP Level 8 at George Brown are deemed to have met the English language requirements for admission to some diploma and certificate programs there.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/General Arts and Science – English for Academic Purposes Program R105 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Information:
- The program requires students to demonstrate competency in communication and flexibility of thought and expression.
- Students are expected to conduct research and write essays/papers/reports according to academic conventions.
- They will develop a wide range of knowledge in various subjects and gain insight into self and society.
- Students need to understand and utilize critical thinking processes and problem-solving techniques.
- The program covers examining and evaluating aspects of changing society to develop personal and social responsibility.
- Students will employ basic vocational skills from humanities, social and behavioural sciences or vocational studies (business, technology).

Fees:
- Domestic tuition for one semester is $1,841.00*.
- September fees include $1,568.13 for tuition and $272.87 for health insurance.
- January fees include $1,568.10 for tuition and $188.90 for health insurance.
- May fees include $1,568.00 for tuition.
- OCAS application fee is $95.
- The program is OSAP eligible.

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) or equivalent for applicants under 18 years old.
- Mature student status* and no OSSD required for applicants 19 years old and above (*19 years of age and older).
- Permanent residents of Canada must present legible copies of both sides of their Permanent Resident Cards or other proof of residency.
- All applicants must complete a placement test and achieve a minimum of Level 1 to be considered for the program.

*Please note: The information contained in this text is subject to change without notice.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/General Arts and Science – English for Academic Purposes Program R105 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Students who wish to join the EAP program at the college are required to take a placement test to determine their English proficiency level. Those who do not have an IELTS (Academic), TOEFL (iBT), or Duolingo score will need to take the EAP level placement test. Applicants can also be placed into an EAP level based on their IELTS, TOEFL, or Duolingo scores, with minimum writing and speaking score requirements as indicated in the text. The table below shows the minimum entry requirements for IELTS and TOEFL tests:

| Test          | Overall | Writing & Speaking |
| ------------- | ------- | ------------------ |
| IELTS         | 9       | 80–91             |
| TOEFL (iBT)   | 105+   | 22                |

The placement test results will determine the EAP starting level for students. The text also mentions that current or returning EAP students who suspend their studies for more than six consecutive eight-week sessions will be placed again based on their new test scores. There is a link provided in the text for those interested in taking the IELTS test in Toronto.

Therefore, the extracted information includes:

1. Students must take a placement test to determine English proficiency level before beginning the EAP program.
2. Those without an IELTS, TOEFL, or Duolingo score will need to take the EAP level placement test.
3. Applicants can be placed into an EAP level based on their IELTS, TOEFL, or Duolingo scores.
4. Minimum entry requirements for IELTS and TOEFL tests (writing and speaking sections).
5. Students will be placed in the EAP starting level that corresponds to their lowest score in all test sections.
6. Current or returning EAP students who suspend their studies for more than six consecutive eight-week sessions will be placed again based on new test scores.
7. Link to George Brown College official IELTS testing service site for those interested in taking the IELTS test in Toronto.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/General Arts and Science – English for Academic Purposes Program R105 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
EAP students who suspend their studies for more than six consecutive eight-week sessions are required to retake the EAP level placement test or submit a valid IELTS, TOEFL, or Duolingo score to be placed back into the program.

Due to COVID-19:
- George Brown College accepts the Duolingo English Test (DET) as a means to demonstrate English language proficiency effective immediately. The DET is an online and on-demand English proficiency test.
- ETS has rolled out a new global service for students to take the TOEFL iBT exams at home, which will be accepted at the same score levels as the regular test during COVID-19 period, except for those in Mainland China and Iran.
- British Council provides testing options for applicants through their IELTS Indicator tool starting April 22, 2020, and GBC will accept this at-home test at the same score levels as the regular test during COVID-19 period.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. Contact information for the School of ESL: phone number 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email esl@georgebrown.ca. For more information about George Brown College, contact their Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.

Related programs: General Arts and Science – English for Academic Purposes (R115), Practical Nursing (PN) (S121), Dental Hygiene (S134).

Websites mentioned in the text: https://englishtest.duolingo.com/, https://www.ieltsindicator.com/
